guardrail_config.description: Clinical Guardrail Configuration for GenAI Sepsis Prediction Pipeline
guardrail_config.purpose: Safety layer to override AI predictions when critical clinical thresholds are breached
guardrail_config.change_log: v3.0 - Updated thresholds based on SME feedback, added history checks, tiered HR thresholds, new hematologic markers

critical_thresholds._description: These are HARD limits. If ANY of these are breached AND AI risk < 80, the system will override to CRITICAL (risk score = 95).

sbp_critical.description: Systolic Blood Pressure. Below this indicates severe hypotension requiring immediate intervention.
sbp_critical.clinical_rationale: SBP ≤ 90 is a Sepsis-3 criterion for septic shock
sbp_critical.sme_notes: Suggestive of sepsis if hypotension persists AFTER fluid resuscitation. Slightly low SBP often indicates dehydration - if normalizes after fluids, probably not septic shock. Trending is important.
sbp_critical.context_check: Assess for bleeding, dehydration, PE, anaphylaxis, or cardiogenic shock

map_critical.description: Mean Arterial Pressure. Below this indicates inadequate organ perfusion.
map_critical.clinical_rationale: MAP < 65 indicates need for vasopressor support per Surviving Sepsis Campaign
map_critical.sme_notes: If lactate > 2 plus MAP < 65, suggests likely septic shock. If history of chronic HTN, MAP < 75 suggests septic shock.
map_critical.context_check: Check lactate level and history of chronic hypertension

map_critical_htn_patient.description: MAP threshold for patients with chronic hypertension history.
map_critical_htn_patient.clinical_rationale: Patients with chronic HTN have higher baseline MAP; lower threshold may miss shock
map_critical_htn_patient.applies_when: Patient has documented history of chronic hypertension

dbp_critical.description: Diastolic Blood Pressure. Severely low indicates cardiovascular collapse.
dbp_critical.clinical_rationale: DBP < 40 often seen in late-stage shock

lactate_elevated.clinical_rationale: Lactate ≥ 2 with hypotension = septic shock per Sepsis-3
lactate_elevated.sme_notes: TRENDING IS VERY IMPORTANT. Lactate > 2 requires REFLEX LACTATE (repeat study) to reassess after fluids.
lactate_elevated.context_check: Check for seizure disorder or recent seizure activity (which elevates lactate)

lactate_severe.description: Severely elevated lactate indicating critical hypoperfusion.

base_excess_critical.description: Severe base deficit indicating metabolic acidosis from hypoperfusion.
base_excess_critical.clinical_rationale: Base excess ≤ -10 suggests severe tissue hypoxia and lactic acidosis

o2sat_critical.description: Oxygen saturation below this indicates severe hypoxemia.

resp_rate_sirs.description: Respiratory rate suggesting early sepsis (qSOFA criterion).
resp_rate_sirs.clinical_rationale: RR ≥ 22 is qSOFA criterion for sepsis screening

resp_rate_critical.description: Respiratory rate indicating severe respiratory distress.
resp_rate_critical.clinical_rationale: RR ≥ 30 suggests high risk of rapid deterioration and impending respiratory failure
resp_rate_critical.sme_notes: Also search chart for subjective criteria of increased work of breathing (WOB)

pao2_fio2_ratio_critical.clinical_rationale: P/F < 200 = moderate ARDS per Berlin criteria, requires mechanical ventilation consideration

paco2_critical_high.clinical_rationale: PaCO2 ≥ 60 suggests ventilatory failure requiring intervention

temp_hypothermia.description: Hypothermia - often worse prognosis than fever in sepsis.
temp_hypothermia.clinical_rationale: Hypothermic sepsis has higher mortality than febrile sepsis

temp_severe_fever.clinical_rationale: Temp ≥ 40°C suggests severe systemic inflammatory response
temp_severe_fever.context_check: Assess for antipyretics within past 4 hours (acetaminophen, ibuprofen, naproxen) which may mask fever

creatinine_critical.description: Creatinine indicating acute kidney injury Stage 3.
creatinine_critical.clinical_rationale: Creatinine ≥ 3.5 = KDIGO Stage 3 AKI, often requires RRT

creatinine_elevated.sme_notes: If NO history of renal disease, this could suggest sepsis-related AKI
creatinine_elevated.context_check: Check for history of renal disease, ESRF, or renal insufficiency. Note in alert if present.

bun_critical.description: Severely elevated BUN indicating renal failure or severe dehydration.
bun_critical.clinical_rationale: BUN ≥ 80 with elevated creatinine suggests severe renal dysfunction

urine_output_concerning.description: Low urine output suggesting early AKI.
urine_output_concerning.clinical_rationale: UO < 0.5 mL/kg/hr x 2 hrs suggests sepsis-related AKI

urine_output_critical.description: Severe oliguria indicating acute kidney injury.
urine_output_critical.clinical_rationale: UO < 0.3 mL/kg/hr for 6+ hours = KDIGO Stage 3 AKI

bilirubin_critical.clinical_rationale: Bilirubin ≥ 4 = severe liver dysfunction in sepsis

bilirubin_elevated.sme_notes: If NO history of liver disease, this could suggest sepsis-related hepatic injury
bilirubin_elevated.context_check: Check for history of liver disease or hepatitis. Note in alert if present.

ast_critical.description: AST indicating acute hepatocellular injury (shock liver).
ast_critical.clinical_rationale: AST ≥ 1000 suggests ischemic hepatitis or severe hepatic damage

alt_critical.clinical_rationale: ALT ≥ 1000 indicates severe hepatic injury requiring urgent evaluation

inr_critical.description: INR indicating severe coagulopathy or liver synthetic failure.
inr_critical.clinical_rationale: INR ≥ 2.5 (non-anticoagulated) suggests DIC or hepatic failure

platelets_critical.description: Platelet count indicating severe thrombocytopenia (possible DIC).
platelets_critical.clinical_rationale: Platelets < 50k suggests DIC or severe bone marrow suppression
platelets_critical.context_check: Check for history of thrombocytopenia. Note in alert if present.

platelets_concerning.clinical_rationale: Platelets < 100k would support a sepsis diagnosis

wbc_critical_high.description: Severe leukocytosis indicating overwhelming infection or leukemoid reaction.
wbc_critical_high.clinical_rationale: WBC ≥ 30k suggests severe bacterial infection or requires hematology consult

wbc_infection.clinical_rationale: WBC ≥ 12k is starting threshold suggesting infection

wbc_critical_low.description: Severe leukopenia indicating immunocompromise or bone marrow suppression.
wbc_critical_low.clinical_rationale: WBC < 2k = severe neutropenia with high infection mortality risk

wbc_viral_infection.description: Low WBC suggesting severe viral infection.
wbc_viral_infection.clinical_rationale: WBC ≤ 4k significant for severe viral infection
wbc_viral_infection.sme_notes: More important is the combination: low lymphocytes + high neutrophils + high bands

neutrophils_high.description: High neutrophil percentage suggesting bacterial infection.

lymphocytes_low.description: Low lymphocyte count indicating severe infection.

bands_high.description: High band count (immature neutrophils) suggesting serious bacterial infection.
bands_high.clinical_rationale: Bands ≥ 10% suggests serious bacterial infection (left shift)

hemoglobin_critical.clinical_rationale: Hgb < 7 g/dL is transfusion threshold per TRICC trial

ptt_critical.clinical_rationale: PTT ≥ 80s suggests DIC or severe clotting factor deficiency

fibrinogen_critical.description: Low fibrinogen indicating DIC or consumptive coagulopathy.
fibrinogen_critical.clinical_rationale: Fibrinogen < 100 in sepsis strongly suggests DIC

d_dimer_critical.description: Markedly elevated D-dimer suggesting DIC or massive thrombosis.
d_dimer_critical.clinical_rationale: D-dimer ≥ 10 with thrombocytopenia = high probability DIC

ph_critical_low.clinical_rationale: pH < 7.25 indicates severe acidemia requiring immediate correction

ph_critical_high.clinical_rationale: pH ≥ 7.55 can cause arrhythmias and neurological dysfunction

co2_early_acidosis.description: Low CO2/bicarbonate indicating early metabolic acidosis.

glucose_critical_low.clinical_rationale: Glucose < 50 mg/dL can cause seizures, coma, and death

glucose_critical_high.description: Severe hyperglycemia indicating DKA or HHS.
glucose_critical_high.clinical_rationale: Glucose ≥ 500 with infection suggests DKA/HHS requiring ICU care

glucose_elevated_diabetic.clinical_rationale: In diabetic patients, glucose ≥ 180 should be noted and compared to baseline
glucose_elevated_diabetic.context_check: Check history of diabetes and compare to baseline. Also check if patient is on corticosteroids (which can elevate glucose).

potassium_critical_high.description: Severe hyperkalemia with cardiac arrest risk.
potassium_critical_high.clinical_rationale: K+ ≥ 6.5 requires immediate treatment to prevent cardiac arrest

sodium_critical_low.clinical_rationale: Na+ < 120 can cause cerebral edema and seizures

sodium_critical_high.clinical_rationale: Na+ ≥ 160 causes severe dehydration and mental status changes

bicarbonate_critical_low.description: Severely low bicarbonate indicating metabolic acidosis.
bicarbonate_critical_low.clinical_rationale: HCO3 < 12 with elevated lactate = severe septic shock

hr_early_sepsis.clinical_rationale: HR ≥ 90 is typically used to suggest early sepsis evaluation

hr_evaluation_threshold.description: Heart rate threshold commonly used for sepsis evaluation.
hr_evaluation_threshold.clinical_rationale: HR ≥ 100 is commonly used threshold for sepsis evaluation

hr_severe_stress.description: Heart rate indicating severe physiologic stress.
hr_severe_stress.clinical_rationale: HR ≥ 120 signals severe physiologic stress, especially when combined with abnormal temperature or respiratory distress

hr_critical_low.description: Severe bradycardia indicating potential cardiovascular collapse.

troponin_critical.clinical_rationale: Troponin ≥ 1.0 in sepsis = septic cardiomyopathy or demand ischemia

bnp_critical.description: Markedly elevated BNP indicating heart failure.
bnp_critical.clinical_rationale: BNP ≥ 1000 suggests significant cardiac dysfunction in sepsis

gcs_critical.description: Glasgow Coma Scale indicating coma - requires airway protection.
gcs_critical.clinical_rationale: GCS ≤ 8 = coma, requires airway protection and ICU care

gcs_encephalopathy.description: GCS indicating moderate to severe encephalopathy.
gcs_encephalopathy.clinical_rationale: GCS ≤ 12 suggests moderate to severe encephalopathy

procalcitonin_suggestive.clinical_rationale: PCT > 2 is suggestive of bacterial sepsis

procalcitonin_critical.description: Markedly elevated procalcitonin indicating severe bacterial sepsis or septic shock.

crp_critical.description: Markedly elevated CRP indicating severe inflammation.
crp_critical.clinical_rationale: CRP ≥ 200 with clinical signs suggests severe infection

early_detection_patterns._description: Combination patterns that suggest early/impending sepsis before critical thresholds are breached

earliest_reliable_lab.description: EARLIEST RELIABLE LAB combination for bacterial infection
earliest_reliable_lab.action: High suspicion for serious bacterial infection - escalate priority

early_sepsis_vitals.description: Early vital sign pattern suggesting sepsis
early_sepsis_vitals.action: Evaluate for early sepsis - consider qSOFA and SIRS criteria

history_context_checks._description: Medical history and context checks that modify interpretation of lab values and vitals. These should be noted in alert scripts.

renal_history.impact: If present, elevated creatinine may be baseline. If NO history and Cr > 2.0, suggests sepsis-related AKI.
renal_history.alert_action: Note any history of renal disease in alert script

hepatic_history.impact: If present, elevated bilirubin/AST/ALT may be baseline. If NO history, suggests sepsis-related hepatic injury.
hepatic_history.alert_action: Note any history of liver disease in alert script

hematologic_history.impact: If present, low platelets or abnormal WBC may be baseline.
hematologic_history.alert_action: Note any history of thrombocytopenia or hematologic disorder in alert script

cardiovascular_history.impact: If chronic HTN present, MAP threshold should be < 75 (not < 65) for septic shock suspicion.
cardiovascular_history.alert_action: Note chronic HTN and use adjusted MAP threshold

diabetes_history.impact: Compare glucose to patient's baseline. Note if glucose ≥ 180 in diabetic patient.
diabetes_history.alert_action: Note diabetes history in alert script and compare to baseline glucose

corticosteroids.alert_action: Note if patient is on corticosteroids when reporting elevated glucose

antipyretics.impact: Can mask fever if given within past 4 hours
antipyretics.alert_action: Note recent antipyretic use when temperature appears normal

anticoagulants.impact: INR may be elevated due to medication, not DIC
anticoagulants.alert_action: Note anticoagulation status when interpreting INR

neurologic_history.impact: Altered mental status must be NEW ONSET to be significant for sepsis.
neurologic_history.alert_action: Note existing conditions affecting mental status. Only escalate for NEW ONSET AMS.

seizure_history.impact: Seizure activity can elevate lactate independent of sepsis.
seizure_history.alert_action: Note seizure history when interpreting elevated lactate

differential_diagnosis._description: Alternative diagnoses to consider when hypotension or shock-like presentation is detected

for_hypotension.alert_action: If any of these are present or suspected, include in alert script as differential diagnosis

trending_requirements._description: Parameters that require trending/repeat measurements for accurate interpretation

lactate.action: Lactate > 2.0 requires REFLEX LACTATE (repeat measurement) after fluid resuscitation
lactate.timing: Repeat 2-4 hours after initial result and/or after fluid bolus
lactate.interpretation: If lactate decreases with fluids, less concerning. If persists or rises, suggests ongoing hypoperfusion.

blood_pressure.action: SBP < 90 requires assessment of fluid responsiveness
blood_pressure.interpretation: If SBP normalizes after fluid resuscitation, likely dehydration not septic shock. If persists, likely septic shock.

urine_output.action: Track hourly for at least 2-6 hours
urine_output.interpretation: UO < 0.5 mL/kg/hr for 2+ hours is concerning. UO < 0.3 mL/kg/hr for 6+ hours is critical.

override_logic._description: Rules for when to override AI predictions

trigger_conditions.description: Override is triggered when ANY critical threshold is breached AND AI risk_score is below the minimum_risk_for_critical
trigger_conditions.notes: If AI gives risk < 80 but critical thresholds are breached, force override to 95

override_values.notes: These values are applied when override is triggered

shock_criteria.description: Specific combination for septic shock detection
shock_criteria.condition_1: SBP <= 90 OR MAP < 65 (or MAP < 75 if chronic HTN)
shock_criteria.action: Immediate escalation to Septic Shock classification

dic_criteria.action: Flag as DIC - immediate hematology consult recommended

qsofa_criteria._description: Quick SOFA score for bedside assessment - used for early sepsis screening

altered_mentation.notes: Must be NEW ONSET. Detected from nursing notes via LLM.

score_interpretation.2-3: High risk - consider ICU level care

discordance_rules._description: Rules for detecting 'Silent Sepsis' - stable vitals but concerning documentation

mental_status_phrases.exclusions: Check for existing conditions: Alzheimer's, dementia, delirium, alcoholism (ETOH), substance abuse, cognitive dysfunction

discordance_rules.action: If concerning phrases detected but AI risk < 60, escalate to minimum 70 with 'High' priority

audit_settings.description: Near miss = AI gave 75-80 but no override triggered. Log for review.

expert_notes.instructions: Clinical SMEs can adjust thresholds in this file. Changes take effect when the container is restarted or config is reloaded via API.
expert_notes.caution: Lowering critical thresholds will increase sensitivity but may cause alert fatigue. Raising them may miss critical patients.
expert_notes.validation: Test any threshold changes against retrospective data before production deployment.
expert_notes.escalation_path: If unsure about a threshold change, consult with ICU attending and clinical informatics team.
key_principles: Trending is often more important than single values
Context matters - always check patient history
NEW ONSET changes are more significant than chronic abnormalities
Consider differential diagnoses before concluding sepsis
Document rationale for overrides in alert scripts
